newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China United issues shrs to fund purchase.
newsitem.headline: China United issues shrs to fund purchase.

text.p: China United Holdings Ltd has agreed to issue 72.87 million new shares, or 8.7 percent of the expanded share capital, at HK$0.433 per share, raising capital to fund its purchase of an additional stake in a subsidiary, it said in a statement published on Thursday.

China United said it would buy an additional 34 percent of Rich Reward Holdings Ltd from the subsidiary's director Chan Ka Keung for HK$31.55 million, raising the company's stake in the subsidiary to 85 percent from 51 percent.
Chan currently holds 49 percent of the subsidiary.
Rich Reward engages in manufacturing and sales of high-tech switching power supplies for use in computer and telecommunications equipment.
China United's managing director Peter Lam said there was much room for future expansion of the subsidiary, which planned to develop new markets in Europe.
Trading in the company's shares, suspended on Wednesday, resumes on Thursday.
